text.__SUMMARY__: Prunus × fruticans or Prunus fruticans, is a species of shrubby Prunus, reaching about 4 m. It is thought to be a naturally occurring hybrid of sloe, Prunus spinosa, and bullace, Prunus domestica var. insititia, found mainly in Europe where their ranges overlap. It is a tetraploid.
text.Description:
It is very similar to the sloe, but with larger leaves and fruit, and the mature leaves remain hairy on their undersides.
